item.dc:creator: michelvaldrighi
item.description: added metaweblog methods: newPost, editPost, getPost -- UNTESTED (yet)

item.title: Ticket #239 (post_category column was never assigned values) created
item.dc:creator: mike
item.description: The post_category was never assigned values after posting. It was only assigned when posting throught xmlrpc/mail interface. But it was still used in some of the functions, such as previous_post or next_post. The problem is that since the post_cateogry was never assigned, it will contain the default value "0", and therefore, the category exclusion in functions that use this column for checking will never make any exclusion on categories.

item.title: Changeset [1562]: added blogger.editPost and blogger.deletePost, time to move on to ...
item.dc:creator: michelvaldrighi
item.description: added blogger.editPost and blogger.deletePost, time to move on to metaWeblog API addition

item.title: Ticket #238 (xmlrpc interface doesn't support metaWeblog.getUsersBlogs) created
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description:
this method was defined in the metaweblog api updated spec, but never properly published: ​http://www.xmlrpc.com/stories/storyReader$2460

flickr (​http://www.flickr.com/) requires this method to be implemented, to be able to use the metaWeblogAPI interface. until this method is implemented, flickr will suggest using the blogger v1 api for posting to wordpress blogs.

item.title: Ticket #237 (xmlrpc parses boolean elements incorrectly) created
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description:
given the following xml:

<value><boolean>true</boolean></value>

the xmlrpc parser returns a scalar of 0 instead of 1

item.title: Ticket #225 (wp_list_cats uses hardcoded date format) updated
item.dc:creator: chuyeow
item.description:
Hi there devs!

I've uploaded a patch that adds a 'optiondatesformat' parameter to the wp_list_cats() function (and consequently also to the list_cats() function which is called from wp_list_cats()). This query will take in a PHP date() function type format string (default is 'j/m' - the currently used hard-coded format).

So, as an example, you can print the list of categories like so: <?php wp_list_cats('optiondates=1&optiondatesformat=j M'); ?>

Granted, 'optiondatesformat' is a tad lengthy so another variable name may be more prudent.

item.title: Ticket #231 (wp_list_cats outputs <br> (XHTML invalid) instead of <br>) updated
item.dc:creator: chuyeow
item.description: Hmm... Looking at CVS 2004-08-24, this seems to have been fixed.

item.title: Ticket #236 (Auto-linked URLs ending with ',' shouldn't include the '.') updated
item.dc:creator: chuyeow
item.description:
Added a diff file as fix for this. (working on CVS 2004-08-23 revision 1.40 of functions-formatting.php)

edited on: 08-24-04 05:06

item.title: Ticket #236 (Auto-linked URLs ending with ',' shouldn't include the '.') created
item.dc:creator: chuyeow
item.description:
Check out this comment: ​http://blog.codefront.net/archives/2004/08/22/looking-for-hosting/#comment-2978

The commentor typed in a URL that came at the end of a sentence and so added a period at the end ("​http://www.linode.com/products/linodes.cfm."). WordPress parsed and auto-linked the URL and included the period in the href attribute.

This should be a special case and the '.' shouldn't be interpreted as part of the URL.

item.title: Changeset [1556]: Add is_year(), is_month(), is_day(), is_time().
item.dc:creator: rboren

item.title: Ticket #235 (get_extended() will lose text after second <--more--> in post) created
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
In the latest from CVS, in wp-includes/functions-post.php, the function get_extended() explodes post content in such a way as to never return text after a second <!--more-->.

Much like bug <a href="​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/bug_view_page.php?bug_id=0000113">bug 0000113</a>. Diff attached.
